intro: Appendicula peruligera, commonly known as the Peruligera appendicula, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its fruits are small, dry schizocarps. Appendicula peruligera is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
